Detailed Description

Routines to read .conf type config files.

Each entry is composed of a key and a value. The entries are maintained a hash table. Each entry can be retrieved from the key.

Function Documentation

void open_config ( const char *  config_file,
long  protect 
)

Start the read config process by opening .conf files and fill the entries in a hash table.

A key can be protected. If a key is not protected, newer entries with the same key will override a previous entry. 

00167                                                        {
00168     if(!config_file) return;
00169     if(!check_suffix(config_file, ".conf")){
00170     error("config file '%s' doesn't end with .conf.\n", config_file);
00171     }
00172     FILE *fd=NULL;
00173     char *sline=NULL;
00174     char *var=NULL, *value=NULL;
00175     ENTRY entry;
00176     ENTRY *entryfind=NULL;
00177     int recordcount=0;
00178     if(!store){
00179     hcreate(MAX_ENTRY);
00180     store=calloc(MAX_ENTRY,sizeof(STORE_T));
00181     nstore=0;
00182     nused=0;
00183     }
00184     char *fn=find_file(config_file);
00185     if(!(fd=fopen(fn,"r"))){
00186     error("File %s doesn't exist\n",fn);
00187     }
00188     const size_t sslineln=4096;
00189     char ssline[sslineln];
00190     ssline[0]='\0';//stores the available line.
00191     const int linemax=4096;
00192     char line[linemax];
00193     while (fgets(line, linemax, fd)){
00194     sline=squeeze(line);
00195     //lines ended with \ will continue on next line
00196     if(!sline || sline[0]=='\0')
00197         continue;
00198     if(sline){
00199         if((strlen(sline)+strlen(ssline))>=sslineln){
00200         error("Please make ssline longer\n");
00201         }
00202         strcat(ssline, sline);
00203     }
00204     if(ssline[strlen(ssline)-1]=='\\'){
00205         ssline[strlen(ssline)-1]=' ';
00206         continue;
00207     }
00208     var=strtok(ssline, "=");
00209     value=strtok(NULL, "=");
00210     strtrim(&var);
00211     strtrim(&value);
00212     if(strtok(NULL,"=") || !var || strlen(var)==0){
00213         error("Line '%s' is invalid\n",line);
00214     }else if(var && !strcmp(var,"include")){
00215         //info("Opening embeded config file %s\n",value);
00216         char *embeded=strextract(value);
00217         if(embeded){
00218         print_override=0;
00219         open_config(embeded,protect);
00220         print_override=1;
00221         free(embeded);
00222         }
00223     }else{
00224         store[nstore].key=entry.key=strdup(var);
00225         if(value && strlen(value)>0){
00226         store[nstore].data=strdup(value);
00227         }else{
00228         store[nstore].data=NULL;
00229         }
00230         store[nstore].protect=protect;
00231         entry.data=(void*)nstore;//record entry.
00232         if((entryfind=hsearch(entry,FIND))){
00233         //same key found
00234         long istore=(long)(entryfind->data);
00235         if(store[istore].protect && !protect){
00236             info2("%s is protected, has {%s}, will not override by {%s}\n",
00237               (char*)entry.key, (char*)store[istore].data,
00238               (char*)store[nstore].data);
00239             free(store[nstore].key);
00240             free(store[nstore].data);
00241         }else{
00242             if(print_override && 
00243                (((store[istore].data==NULL || store[nstore].data==NULL)
00244              &&(store[istore].data != store[nstore].data))||
00245             ((store[istore].data!=NULL && store[nstore].data!=NULL)
00246              &&strcmp((char*)store[istore].data,(char*)store[nstore].data)))){
00247             info2("Overriding %s:\t{%s}-->{%s}\n", 
00248                   entry.key, (char*)store[istore].data,
00249                   (char*)store[nstore].data);
00250             }
00251             //free old value
00252             if(store[istore].data)
00253             free(store[istore].data);
00254             //copy pointer of new value.
00255             store[istore].data=store[nstore].data;
00256             store[istore].protect=store[nstore].protect;
00257             //free key.
00258             free(store[nstore].key);
00259         }
00260         store[nstore].key=NULL;
00261         store[nstore].data=NULL;
00262         }else{
00263         //new key
00264         entryfind=hsearch(entry,ENTER);
00265         recordcount++;
00266         nstore++;
00267         if(nstore>MAX_ENTRY-2){
00268             MAX_ENTRY*=2;
00269             store=realloc(store,MAX_ENTRY*sizeof(STORE_T));
00270         }
00271         }
00272     }
00273     ssline[0]='\0';
00274     }
00275     fclose(fd);
00276     info2("loaded %3d new records from %s\n",recordcount,fn);
00277     free(fn);
00278 }

void close_config ( const char *  format,
  ... 
)

End the read config process and output the effective config hash table into a file for later reference. 

00124                                           {
00125     format2fn;
00126     const char *fnout=fn;
00127     if(store){
00128     info2("Used %ld of %ld supplied keys\n",nused,nstore);
00129     if(fnout && strlen(fnout)>0){
00130         FILE *fp=fopen(fnout,"w");
00131         for(int i=0; i<nstore; i++){
00132         if(store[i].data)
00133             fprintf(fp,"%s=%s\n",store[i].key,store[i].data);
00134         else
00135             fprintf(fp,"%s=\n",store[i].key);
00136         }
00137         fclose(fp);
00138     }
00139     for(int i=0; i<nstore; i++){
00140         if(store[i].count==0){
00141         print_file("change.log");
00142         error("key \"%s\" is not recognized, value is %s\n", store[i].key,store[i].data);
00143         }else if(store[i].count!=1){
00144         //this should not happen.
00145         error("Key %s is used %ld times\n", store[i].key,store[i].count);
00146         }
00147 #if defined(__linux__)
00148         //Linux doesn't free the keys. but Mac does.
00149         free(store[i].key);//free key;
00150 #endif
00151         if(store[i].data){
00152         free(store[i].data);//free value
00153         }
00154     }
00155     hdestroy();
00156     free(store);
00157     store=NULL;
00158     }else{
00159     warning("Store is empty\n");
00160     }
00161 }

)

00310     entry.key=key2;
00311     if(hsearch(entry,FIND)){

00320                                          {
00321     format2key;
00322     char *data;
00323     long irecord=getrecord(key);
00324     if(irecord!=-1){
00325     const char *sdata=store[irecord].data;
00326     if(sdata && strlen(sdata)>0){
00327         data=strextract(sdata);
00328     }else{
00329         data=NULL;
00330     }
00331     }else{
00332     error("key '%s' not found\n", key);
00333     data=NULL;
00334     }
00335     return data;
00336 }

int readcfg_strarr ( char ***  res,
const char *  format,
  ... 
)

Obtain a string array value from the key.

revised on 2010-10-16 to be more strict on the entry to avoid mistakes. 

00341                                                        {
00342     //Read str array.
00343     format2key;
00344     long irecord=getrecord(key);
00345     int count=0, maxcount=5;
00346     *res=calloc(maxcount,sizeof(char*));
00347     if(irecord!=-1){
00348     const char *sdata=store[irecord].data;
00349     const char *sdataend=sdata+strlen(sdata)-1;
00350     const char *sdata2, *sdata3, *sdata4;
00351     if(sdata[0]!='[' || sdataend[0]!=']'){
00352         info("sdata[0]=%c, sdataend[0]=%c\n",sdata[0], sdataend[0]);
00353         error("key %s: Entry (%s) should start with [ and end with ]\n",key, sdata);
00354     }
00355     sdata2=sdata+1;
00356     sdataend--;
00357     //find each string.
00358     while(sdata2<sdataend && (sdata2[0]==','||sdata2[0]==';'||!isgraph(sdata2[0]))){
00359         sdata2++;
00360     }
00361     while(sdata2<sdataend){
00362         if(sdata2[0]!='"'){
00363         error("Unable to parse (%s) for str array\n", sdata);
00364         }
00365         sdata3=sdata2+1;
00366         sdata4=strchr(sdata3,'"');
00367         if(!sdata4) error("Unmatched ""\n");
00368         if(sdata4>sdata3){
00369         if(count>=maxcount){
00370             maxcount*=2;
00371             *res=realloc(*res,sizeof(char*)*maxcount);
00372         }
00373         (*res)[count]=strndup(sdata3,sdata4-sdata3);
00374         }else{
00375         (*res)[count]=NULL;
00376         }
00377         count++;
00378         sdata2=sdata4+1;
00379         while(sdata2<sdataend && (sdata2[0]==','||sdata2[0]==';'||!isgraph(sdata2[0]))){
00380         sdata2++;
00381         }
00382     }
00383     /*if(*sdata2!=']'){
00384         error("Entry (%s) does not have the right format\n", sdata);
00385         }*/
00386     *res=realloc(*res,sizeof(char*)*count);
00387     }else{
00388     error("key '%s' not found\n", key);
00389     *res=NULL;
00390     }
00391     return count;
00392 }
